title: Best Beach Club - Excellent Service, Food and Price
text:
Located right by the shores of the Sea of Cortez, in the beautiful Medano Beach, Cachet is my favorite and personal best, beach club in Los Cabos.
They count with comfortable beach beds, great music, excellent food and service - we were taken care by Leo. He was awesome. Very friendly, attentive and fun to talk to.
And, last but not least, great value for money.

title: Beautiful Courtyard, Fantastic Food, Great Service
text:
I found this place whilst reading and article on Forbes Travel Guide, thus decided to check the place after reading its menu.
The inner courtyard, felt very cozy and with the soothing sound of a fountain. We sat down for an early dinner and were looked after very well. The staff is gracious, friendly and ready to make recommendations. The menu was great and the food delicious.
We had a lovely experience, we just thought it would have been nice there was so music playing.

title: Loved the Food, Drinks and the View
text:
Excellent place to eat and enjoy drinks. The restaurant has a patio, which despite is nice and very hacienda like, does not offer a view. Opt for the rooftop, from which you can admire one of the best views of the city and the church.
The menu is great, was difficult to choose what we wanted to eat. Every single dish we had was superb, perfectly presented and very tasty.
There is a great selection of cocktails, and we got recommended a special one of the day. It was fantastic.
During our short stay in San Miguel, we came back twice to this place. And I will return again.

title: Wonderful Rooftop with Great Service hidden from Indiscreet Eyes
text:
I found this place whilst strolling around town, a few blocks away from the popular streets and the church. The restaurant is located within a cozy hotel, hidden from indiscreet eyes (as there is no sign). The design was the first thing that caught my attention.

The restaurant located on the rooftop, offer views of the church and has a glass roof as well (great for the windy evening that you may encounter during the winter months).

The service was excellent and so was the food. I just went for dessert, and it was delicious. Whilst reading the menu I decided that I will have to return during my next visit to San Miguel de Allende.

I had probably the best carajillo.

title: Authentic Greek Cuisine Recommended by Local
text:
A local recommended this restaurant for my last night in Milos.
Reservations are highly encouraged, I did not make one but still manage to get a table after a 25 minute wait (not a big deal if not in a hurry).
The restaurant is very popular and is beautifully set, very cozy. Is family owned and every dish is so well prepared and presented.
Staff very friendly and ready to give you suggestions.
Food was fantastic.
Can't wait to return.

title: Excellent Breakfast Spot
text: Friendly and welcoming staff. Cozy little restaurant excellent for breakfast. The food tasted really good and was well presented. There is a beautiful balcony where to enjoy breakfast on sunny days. Pastries were great.

title: As Authentic as in Italy
text:
Wow!
We were welcomed by a very warm and friendly team, we then found they were the owners. So kind and nice, they all were Italians - which was great and you could only expect fantastic food.

The menu was mouth-watering it was very difficult to choose. We ended up sharing all dishes in order to taste more options. Everything was excellent, with a delicious and very authentic taste. It felt to be in Italy. Every dish was cooked with loved and presented very well. Portions are generous.

Excellent value for money. We got offered limoncello at the end of our meal. Great touch.

(My friends found the owner's son who also works there, very attractive).

title: Oceanside Restaurant with Excellent Seafood and Service
text: A beautiful restaurant perched above rocks overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. Is the perfect restaurant to have an al fresco dining and at the same time being in the shade. The menu offers a vast array of items, everything looks fantastic. The seafood is excellent. Very friendly and attentive service.

title: Despite its Location, is not a Tourist Trap. Definitely Worth it!
text: Recommended by a local, this restaurant is by the sea in Klima, just a few steps away from the characteristically fishing houses. Is an al-fresco dining restaurant and with one of the best views of the sunset. The food couldn't be fresher and more delicious. Great options of freshly caught fish. Ask your server for what is fresh. Service is really good and so are the prices. Is definitely not a tourist trap.

title: Delicious Food, Excellent Wines and Great Service
text: I was staying at the hotel thus I decided to have dinner at L'Atelier. The menu is well curated and offering great options. The wine list was great and I had an excellent white wine from the region. All dishes were very well presented and the food was very tasty. The service was great, despite being very busy, the staff was always nice and friendly. They all do speak Italian, so a good advantage if you do - they immediately treat you as family.

title: Fantastic Breakfast Spot with a View
text: Recommended by a local, I had breakfast here. The place is perched above the water, thus the view is fantastic. The menu is great and with many options. Breakfast dishes were generous and very tasty. Great options for anyone looking after their calories and diet. Would definitely be back.

title: Excellent, Authentic and Friendly Staff
text:
Form the moment you step in you are welcome as a family member. The staff is incredibly nice and hospitable. Ready to make excellent recommendations for anything on the menu and the specials of the day.
I ended up going back to the restaurant twice.
The food is extremely well prepared, tasty and presented. I loved every single dish I tried. The cuisine is really authentic and homy.
This is the best restaurant in Plaka and with great prices (hence not a tourist trap).

title: Ok and Tasty Food, Overpriced
text:
I honestly got confused because on the Main Street there are two different menus of two different restaurants. And once I entered the restaurant I didn't realise I wanted to go to the other one, however I decided to give it a try.
The menu was small, not much variety offered. The food was ok tasty, however the portions were too small. I felt the prices were higher for the dishes you get.

title: Cozy Restaurant with Excellent Pizza Napoletana
text: The restaurant is a bit hidden, but once you have found it is very nice. Is small and cozy and feels very homy. The staff is very kind and friendly. Pizzas are excellent, I went for a traditional pizza Napoletana.

title: Excellent Food and Views
text:
Overlooking the calm bay of Apollonia, this restaurant is great. I choose the table closes to the sea and I felt I was dining overwater.

Great selection of seafood and other excellent choices. The cuisine was a true delight. I had the best Salad Niçoise ever.

title: Delicious Breakfast with a View and Excellent Service
text:
First impression is the view which is great overlooking the bay of Apollonia.

Small curated menu with great selections for breakfast. Dishes very well presented and very tasty, very homey. The staff is beyond nice. Were so friendly and you could see they were smiling even if they had a mask on.

Excellent spot for breakfast.

title: Cute Hotel, Perfect Vacation
text:
A cute and charming little boutique hotel, in a peaceful surrounding overlooking the Aegean Sea. From the moment you arrive you will fall in love with the hotel, it makes you feel as if you were home.

The employees are very genuine and friendly. They took all the precautionary measures during this pandemic to make you feel safe, secure and adhering to the highest health and safety protocols.

The rooms are nice, spacious, with a kitchenette and terrace. Pay the little difference to have sea views.

I would definitely come back.

title: Great and Authentic Greek Cuisine
text: Recommended by a local, the restaurant offers great and authentic Greek cuisine at very good prices. The ambiance is casual and the staff is very friendly and attentive. Many choices and portions are generous.

title: Fantastic Tour and Overview of Athens. Thanks Maria Elena!
text:
I took the tour in Spanish with Maria Elena, and she was the best guide. She made the tour very interesting, to the point and including many stories of the Greek mythology. It is great to get on a tour learn the history of the city, country you are but that you do not feel like you are in a history class, and Maria Elena did exactly that.

Get ready to walk quite a few Kms, thus I'd suggest you do the morning or the evening tour, but you won't feel it.

The tour is fantastic to get an excellent overview of Athens, thus try to do it on your first day. From then you can plan the rest of your time in the Greek capital.

Maria Elena gave us excellent recommendations for Greek specialties, local beers, must visits and dos and taught some Greek too.

title: Not to be missed, go up early
text: This is a must visit whilst in Athens. You cannot missed on this. Do however travel in the morning, I would suggest to go as soon as they open. When there is not many people and the sun is not very strong. As there is no shade anywhere and the Athenian sun can be very strong.

title: Great hotel, Nice Staff, Great New Covid Protocols
text:
The hotel is great and rooms are spacious, modern, comfortable and quiet. The hotel is well located only 2Km form the Acropolis, but the area doesn't seem to offer much.

These are difficult times to travel and Grand Hyatt Athens did a great effort to commit to all the new health and safe protocol to make you really feel safe and comfortable with peace of mind. Well done.

title: Excellent Location, Great Value for Money
text:
I travel every year to Montreux. This time I decided to venture a bit outside the crowded city and found this beautiful hotel. Which is located right on the main road, overlooking the lake, mountains and vineyards. The hotel has on site free parking (great feature you won't get in Montreux). The employees were very friendly and kind. The rooms are simple, but spacious and comfortable. Basically everything you need. There is also an on-site fitness centre and the restaurant in the hotel is very good.
Excellent option to discover the nearby towns of the Lavaux region, eat excellent food and try fantastic wines. I will definitely come back to Hotel Lavaux (I actually ended up extending my stay).

title: Exquisite Cuisine & Breathtaking Views
text:
Hands down for one of the best dining experience I had in Ticino. I have been coming to Ticino for many many years and I finally found a place that blew me away. Ristorante Al Braciere is a cozy little restaurant located in Ronco s/Ascona, a ten minute drive from Ascona where I always stay. The first impression of the place was its view - wow - a million dollar view of the lake and the mountains.
We were greeted immediately by Cristian, in a friendly and genuine manner. He accommodated us on the terrace; we just couldn't stop talking about how amazing the view was.

We started our dinner with a nice aperol for aperitivo. Then we got served some local sparkling one; it was excellent. Glad we asked for a recommendation for our second drink.

The menu is very well curated, with many regional ingredients fused with international flavours. Everything look delicious, thus we went for the tasting menu. Every single dish from the amuse-bouche to the dessert were superb. All dishes were like pieces of art (yes we had to take pictures of each dish) and had a freshly fantastic taste.

The attention of our server was excellent, we never had to ask to refill our glasses. Every details was taken well care of.

We had the moscato granita for dessert which was very refreshing. Wish I could have that recipe. After dessert we were surprised with another excellent dessert, as I casually mentioned it was our anniversary.

It truly was a memorable night and impossible-to-forget dining experience. It is now my favourite restaurant in the area and I cannot wait to go back.

title: Excellent Museum
text: Great museum, don't miss it. You get the audioguide tour on your own phone at no additional cost (very informative and interesting).
place: Kiek in de Kok and Bastion Passages Museum

title: Don't Miss It
text: This little charming alley is not to be missed - get to see some artisans work, from wood, to glass to paintings. Great spot for pictures too.

title: Excellent Views
text: Enjoy excellent views of the old town and sea on the horizon. One of the many great spots to capture nice pictures.

title: Stunning
text: The most beautiful Medieval town I have ever seen. It is like taking a step back in time, the old town in very well preserved - try get there early morning if you would like to take nice pictures. After dinner in town take an evening stroll.

title: Excellent, Comfortable and steps from Old Town
text: Hardly to believe is a hostel, I booked a private room with bathroom and it was very spacious and great sleep quality. The location is perfect, is a few steps from the city walls and the old town - you can walk everywhere and there is bus and tram stops just across the street.

title: Excellent Location
text:
Excellent location in downtown San Diego. Easily accessible and not too far from the airport. Walking distance from Gaslamp district and many restaurants, bars and attractions.
Rooms are cozy with comfortable beds; although not the best soundproof, you can hear the people in the room next door talking.
The macaroons were delicious.

title: Nice place with great breakfast options
text: The restaurant is nice and very inviting. All staff very friendly. The menu has different breakfast options, and all the dishes we ordered were very well presented and very tasty. We really enjoyed having breakfast here - opt for table in the front terrace or back patio.

title: Great Option and Value for Money
text: The hotel is located in a nice and quiet area. The hotel, which once was a house, is nice and cozy. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The room is spacious, quiet, with a lot of natural light and the bed is comfortable. It is a great value for money.

title: Best Luxury Transfers Experience Ever
text:
Have you ever travelled to a destination and unsure on which transportation should you consider taking?
I used VIVO for the first time and I am very impressed; they do provide by far the most professional transfer services, luxurious SUVs at a great value for money.

From the pre-arrival experience - their response time is extremely fast, professional and excellent English communication. They made every so easy for us; we were greeted within the terminal (we did request a special service they offer that helps skip the queue at immigration and customs - that's truly first class service, totally worth it). Our greeter and driver were friendly and vast knowledge of the destination; which made us book a private tour with them to explore more of the Baja.

Hands down, the best service and experience we had in Los Cabos in many years. We will look no further than VIVO during our next visit in October.

title: Not to be missed
text:
This is an experience that cannot be missed. It was one of the most fascinating experiences I ever had. Getting so closed to the Perito Moreno Glacier is something out of this world - truly breath-taking.
As a tip, is better to rent a car and visit the park your self, you will save a lot of money.

title: Overpriced Experience
text:
The location is beautiful, as well as the boat ride on the lake to get there - you get to spot icebergs, which is fascinating. I took the advanced hiking, which was breath-taking and our guide was amazing. Luckily for me we were only two during the hike.
Despite this, the experience to Estancia Cristina is way overpriced - I paid more than 300USD, and it didn't even include lunch, I was charged extra for that. It should also be specified that the boat ride is quite lengthy, this should be communicated in advance.

title: Great Location, Terrible Service
text: The hotel with no doubts has a great location, thus service is definitely not a priority given their location. Upon arrival I had a bad check-in experience - it seemed the manager was having a discussion with the employees (he was very rude, addressing one of the agents with a 'yo girl'); the check-in agent was doing my check-in without even looking at me in the eyes, still complaining about the manager with her colleagues, and let's not even talk of being polite or smiley while checking in. The process was slow and inefficient. Rooms are small (not surprised, it's NYC) and they A/C was on and it was freezing outside; in addition it is very noisy.

title: A True Natural Wonder
text: Iguazu Falls are truly natural wonder of the world. Arrive to the park early in the morning and make sure to wear comfortable shoes and be ready to walk. Avoid taking the little trains within the park, sometimes the queues may be long - take a walk if you don't mind it takes definitely less time to walk than waiting in the queue. Make sure to have a very minimum of 4-5 hours to spend at Parque Nacional Iguazu.

title: Great Resort not too far from the Falls
text: Beautiful property located not too far form the city centre, the Falls and the airport. The staff is friendly and efficient. The rooms are beautifully appointed (ours had a balcony overlooking the jungle), with everything you may need. The beds are comfortable and provide great quality of sleep. The resort has a nice and quite atmosphere. The breakfast buffet was good and started early in the morning.

title: Urban Oasis in Puerto Madero
text: Truly an urban oasis, hidden from the indiscreet eyes in the heart of Puerto Madero. The hotel is contemporary and very chic. It has an elegant and sophisticated ambiance. The pool is great to spend the hot summer days when not visiting the city - good food and great cocktails. The service at the pool should be improved somewhat, is slow and lacking more attentiveness from the staff. The spa is beautiful with great facilities and the staff is fantastic. Loved the fitness centre - is huge, for being within a hotel.

title: Great Hostel with Incredible Views
text: Fantastic hostel that offer travelers an incredible value for money option. The hostel has several room options, I was staying in a private room with other two friends. The hostel counts with a bar and a wooden deck and outdoor tables that offer spectacular views of the surroundings. Located a 5-minute walk from downtown. The team that works there is incredible - super friendly and helpful. Upon booking you will receive an email from them with a document highlighting all the best tours in the area (book fast as many of them have limited availability) - bear in mind many of the tours may be somewhat expensive compared to the room rate you are paying.

title: Short Boat Trip
text: Take one of the many boat trip options, this can also be a short 2.5-hour trip. The lighthouse is one of the several stops you can do.

title: Great Full Day Visit
text: You cannot miss a visit to Parque Nacional Tierra del Fuego - the best way to see it is by car (you can rent one for a day) so you can drive to your favourite spot to see first and take you own time to walk around the several trails. Do not forget your camera and make sure to dress well as weather is unpredictable; it can be rainy, windy, sunny and cloudy in less than 45 minutes.

title: Nice for a Boat Trip
text: The Beagle Channel cannot be missed, although you can see if from wherever you are in the city take one of the many boat tours. Make sure to cover properly, even during the summer time as it is always windy and the weather is unpredictable.

title: Great Option at Fantastic Price
text: La Posta is conveniently located very close to the airport and the city centre. It offers great rooms (we were in one of the apartments that accommodate easily up to 4 guests) with private bathroom and small kitchenette. The staff is very friendly and ready to help. Breakfast is included and is very good. Rooms are comfy and offer all necessities.

title: The Trendiest Neighborhood
text: Palermo is by far the trendiest neighborhood in Buenos Aires, which offers a great selection of restaurants, bars and the best places to enjoy the nightlife (just remember, the nightlight in BsAs start very, very late).

title: Great Promenade and Restaurants
text: Puerto Madero is one of the newest areas in the city, offers a beautiful promenade where you can walk and choose from one of the many restaurants bars - during a sunny day opt to see outdoors.

title: The Most Exclusive Area in the City
text: Recoleta is definitely the nicest and chicest area in the capital; even though you are not staying here spend some of your time walking around to observe the magnificent architecture.

title: The Best Hostel I've Been to... Your Best Choice in Buenos Aires
text: Selina Palermo Soho is by far the best hostel I've been too. This place is new, it's been open for a month and is located in one of the trendiest areas in Buenos Aires, where you can find lots of bars, restaurants, clubs at a walking distance. Selina has a chic, trendy vibe with nice and comfortable rooms. The employees are so great, friendly and ready to help. Did I mention they have the most amazing rooftop where you can enjoy the beautiful sunsets in BsAs, with a DJ playing great music and bartenders preparing nice drinks - is the perfect spot to socialize and end your day.

title: A New Delightful Dining Experience
text:
We visited the newly Latino 8 one day after it opened its doors. We are normally somewhat conscious in visiting recently open places, however Latino 8 did not disappoint. The menu was very well thought and with several specialities from several countries; from Mexico to Brazil, Argentina and Peru. It all looked mouthwatering. The cocktail menu was great too - very well presented and tasty drinks. The food was very well presented and it was good. Service was ok (again they were opened for barely 24 hours) so they did a very good job and we are confident it will only get better.
Prices are fair considering its location. Worth the visit.

title: Great Breakfast Option
text:
I came across this amazing place while walking through Downtown San Jose del Cabo, I was brought in by the delightful smell of fresh baked bread:

The French Riviera has the best croissants and pain au chocolat in town.

My breakfast was great and the service was impeccable.

When going to San Jose you can’t miss out on this amazing experience!

title: Worst Experience Ever
text: Try a different option. My flight got cancelled and we were not even informed ahead of time - we noticed on the screens in the terminal at time of boarding time that the flight was cancelled. The customers service agents were the worst; to get rid off of me I was sent to Krakow in order to fly back to Zurich; when I was in Poland I realized I was on stand-by on the following flight. Not to mentioned that due to this cancelation I lost my flight from Zurich to Mexico, which resulted in changes over 1,000USD.

title: Literally The Best Sushi in Los Cabos
text: I know that opinions are all personal, but believe me - this is by far the best sushi place in Los Cabos. When you first get there and see the place from outside, most people would not notice the place nor tend to get there - but never judge a book for its cover. The restaurant is small and cozy. Attentive and friendly efficient service. The sushi, sashimi and all the other specialties are delicious, best sea food quality and there is no other place in the area that has such great Japanese food. When it cannot get any better, the price is not at all elevated. You won't be disappointed.

title: Italian food for American Tourists
text:
I've eaten at many authentic Italian restaurants and this is not one of them. The food is ok but not great. The portions are huge, it couldn't be more obvious they cater to American tourists. The service is average, although the people are very nice.
The dessert (tiramisú) was disappointing, I was told was the best option they had - had half a tea spoon of it and left it there.

title: Great Sushi at Great Price
text: Great sushi options - either if you eat at the small restaurant or do take away. Staff is nice and friendly, sushi chef very efficient. The sushi is delicious, very well presented and fresh.

title: As Perfect as a Dream
text: One&Only The Palm is by far the best resort in Dubai and with the most unique location you can possibly imagine. The resort is so beautiful and from the moment you arrive you may think you are dreaming. If you are seeking for privacy this is the place for you, the resort has boutique feel and even when is full you don't get to see many people. The culinary offerings are beyond expectations - our favourite was 101; overlooking the private marina and Dubai skyline. The service is flawless and the staff very friendly and always ready to anticipate your needs. The main pool is beautiful and if you like extra privacy there are cabanas available.

title: Beautiful Hotel & Perfect Location
text: As many of you, reading this now, I decided to come to the Beverly Wilshire hotel because of the movie Pretty Woman. The hotel is beautifully appointed, elegant and set perhaps in the best location in Beverly Hills. The rooms are spacious and with beautiful views - I could see the Hollywood sign from my room. The staff is friendly and very professional - they all made us feel special. We really enjoyed breakfast at Blvd and loved the complimentary car service - perfect if you go shopping at the endless options of boutiques around the hotel. Would definitely consider coming back.
place: Beverly Wilshire Beverly Hills (A Four Seasons Hotel)

title: By Far the Best Bakery
text: Chaumont is by far the best bakery I ever visited; it has a perfect location, with fantastic options to eat there or to go. The chocolate or almond croissants are to die for - better than any I've tried in France. Look no further, it cannot get any better than Chaumont.

title: Stunning Hotel
text: The Waldorf Astoria is such an incredible hotel. It speaks luxury from the moment you enter the drive way and step into the lobby. The front desk staff is fantastic; lovely, professional and extremely helpful. The rooms are spacious, elegantly appointed, the bathrooms are wonderful (very important for me). When you think it doesn't get any better, wait you try the restaurants - overseen by Jean-Georges. The rooftop is breath-taking; it was my favourite spot in the hotel, which offers the best views of the City of Angels.

title: Chic Restaurant with Excellent Food
text: The restaurant is chic and very well designed, with several intimate spaces if you are looking for a more private seating area. The bar is beautiful and you can opt to have dinner there too. The food was delicious and very well presented, the cocktails options were fantastic too, although somewhat expensive. It is a really good option of fine dining Cantonese cuisine.

title: The Best Aquapark in the UAE
text: Aquaventure at Atlantis The Palm is by far the best aquapark in the UAE (and that I have ever been too). There are many many rides to keep you and your friends entertained the whole day, many food outlets with great food and many areas to relax as well - either by the pools or at the beach. An unforgettable day.

title: Beautiful Gardens - worth a short visit
text: Got to know about the Dubai Miracle Gardens because of Instagram pictures posted on several accounts. Despite its location, the Gardens are very well maintained and very nice to talk a nice walk away from the city. Plenty of pictures opportunities. Try to go during the week days to avoid having too many people there.

title: Great Breakfast Option in JBR The Walk
text: As the name suggests, Eggspectation is a great option for breakfast in JBR The Walk. The atmosphere is nice and casual, if the weather permits sit outdoors. The food is good and the service is fast. Food portions are big for the price you pay. I have never seen so many eggs options for breakfast - love it!

title: Idyllic Getaway from Dubai
text: It's always nice to escape from Dubai and Fairmont Fujairah is the perfect getaway. The resort is very nice, the rooms are nice, spacious and very well appointed with beautiful views. We really enjoyed our time by the pool, where we were looked after by attentive staff. The food was great in all the restaurants, the spa was the true highlight of the resort. Next time we are in Dubai we will make sure to escape to this beautiful resort.
placeLocation: Dibba Al Fujairah, United Arab Emirates

title: Great Option close to the Airport
text: Ibis Budget is a really good option if you need to stay overnight at Zurich Airport. The hotel covers all the basic needs at a very affordable price. Rooms are quite and the bed is comfortable. The hotel does not have a shuttle service, nevertheless there is a tram stop right in front of the hotel and the journey to the airport is less than 5 minutes. Very convenient.

title: Ibis is Always a Good Option
text:
Relatively close to the airport (10-15 minute drive), ibis is good option for an overnight stay prior catching your flight. The hotel offers affordable rooms that satisfy all the basic needs, with quiet rooms and comfortable beds. The staff is friendly and helpful.
The only downside is the airport shuttle, although complimentary, only runs twice every hour.

title: Excellent options a few steps from the City Centre
text: Grand Hotel has probably the best location just a few steps from the City Centre. The hotel is beautiful, is like stepping back in time - making you feel like royalty. The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms are spacious and very well appointed. We really enjoyed our stay and we would definitely love to go back.

title: It cannot be missed
text: If you've watched the movie you know you have to visit Oskar Schindler's factory. The museum is designed in a very original and interesting way. Purchase your ticket online so you avoid to queue for too long.
place: Muzeum Krakowa, oddział Fabryka Emalia Oskara Schindlera

title: Stunning
text: The main plaza is stunning. Very charming, with several restaurants, cafes, carrosses for nice city tours. The whole area is pedestrian, the market is very nice. We loved it.

title: By far the Best Breakfast in Town
text: Truly the best breakfast in town. The cafe is nice and charming, and you can smell the bread from the other side of the plaza. Once you enter go downstairs, you get to seat where the bread is baked. Sometimes the waiting time can be long but it is definitely worth waiting. We went back everyday during our short stay in Krakow.

title: Ski-out resort with Breath-Taking Views
text: Great resort with ski-out access to the beautiful slopes of Valle Nevado. The location couldn't not get any better. The rooms are spacious and with breath-taking views of the Andes. The staff is very friendly and the hotel offers an all-inclusive plan (including ski pass and rental). Can't wait to go back.

title: Best Tuna Tartar in Town
text: A casual dining option that offers a great selection of seafood, tacos and much more. They menu offers excellent food options, but the best dish - which is a must try - is the tuna tartar with avocado and mango. It won't disappoint.

title: Don't miss out on an iconic Toronto picture.
text: The reason why I decided to visit this place, despite getting my iconic Toronto sign picture and the cityhall, was because I saw this building in the movie Resident Evil II starring Mila Jovovic.

title: Stunning building
text: Get a sense of the old Canada, right in the middle of modern Downtown. In my opinion is one of the nicest building in that area.

title: The most beautiful street in the city
text: This is something you really do not have to miss out. Get ready with comfortable shoes to walk and admire the beautiful bohemian buildings, nice shops, trendy restaurants, bars and nightlife. Very picturesque.

title: A FLAWLESS Experience
text:
Not trying to exaggerate, but Rosewood Mayakoba was the best resort experience I have ever had. It could not have get any better, not even if I've dreamed about it.
I could write a novel praising how fantastic the resort is, but with limit my review in the major highlights to make it easier for you to read.

The arrival experience is something truly unique. Do not want to give any spoilers, but it's magical.

The rooms are wonderful, nicely and elegantly appointed, spacious, private pool and a daybed on the roof. Extremely private and peaceful. You can have a golf cart picking you up but I preferred to ask for a bike and tour the beautiful property at my own pace.

All the restaurants have delicious food, very well presented (I ended up taking pictures of pretty much all dishes). Excellent service. Punta Bonita was my favourite for lunch - I was surprised with an order of churros (without cinnamon, due to my intolerance - a true wow factor). I will have to go back as I didn't get to experience 'Aqui me Quedo'.

The beach is stunning. The sand seems flour. The amenities and service were outstanding.

Breakfast at Casa del Lago was great - really loved the buffet set up and the a la carte options.

The spa was one of the largest I've ever seen. The wet areas were a true blessing, you can make use of them even though you do not have a scheduled treatment. The fitness centre (which is open 24/7) is great, there are fantastic group fitness classes. Giovanni the personal trainer is a true superstar, I had the best TRX training.

Rosewood Mayakoba is the best resort you can possibly find in the Riviera Maya.

title: Great location, impressive views, fantastic value for money.
text: The hotel has a great location with easy access to the city's main tourist attractions and a 5-minute walk from Warszawa Centralna railway station. The rooms are very nice, elegant and quiet with beautiful views of the city. The fitness centre and the pool were fantastic, located on the top floor. The staff is very nice and friendly. It's a great value for money.

title: Must visit, do not miss out!
text:
It is a tour you cannot missed - the only way not to repeat the same mistakes from the past is to learn from it. There are guided tours in all languages. Bring comfortable shoes as you will walk a lot during the tour of both camps Auschwitz-Birkenau.
Bear in mind to be respectful when visiting the camp.
place: Krakow and Auschwitz Small Group Tour from Warsaw with Lunch

title: Beautiful and picturesque
text: You have to take a walk in the beautiful and picturesque old town. Although it has been completely reconstructed after WWII, it feels as it could have been the original. The buildings, the walls are great to visit. Explore the little streets and discover small restaurants and cafes.

title: Visit Castle Square prior to get to the Old Town
text: Before adventuring into the little streets that will take you to the old town plaza start your walk right on Castle Square. Visit the castle if you have enough time.

title: Perfect Getaway - Breathtaking, Elegant and Quiet
text: Together with my girlfriend we were among the first guests to stay at this new resort in Los Cabos. We were impressed - the resort is very elegant, quiet and with impressive views of the bay. Our room had breath-taking views of the sea and the pools (there are like 6 different pools!); they are spacious and comfortable. We really enjoyed the restaurants; great food and very good and warm service. We will definitely come back!
